operations.AddFlowOutputs: Adds outputs to an existing flow. You can create up to 50 outputs per flow.
operations.CreateFlow: Creates a new flow. The request must include one source. The request optionally can include outputs (up to 50) and entitlements (up to 50).
operations.DeleteFlow: Deletes a flow. Before you can delete a flow, you must stop the flow.
operations.DescribeFlow: Displays the details of a flow. The response includes the flow ARN, name, and Availability Zone, as well as details about the source, outputs, and entitlements.
operations.DescribeOffering: Displays the details of an offering. The response includes the offering description, duration, outbound bandwidth, price, and Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
operations.DescribeReservation: Displays the details of a reservation. The response includes the reservation name, state, start date and time, and the details of the offering that make up the rest of the reservation (such as price, duration, and outbound bandwidth).
operations.GrantFlowEntitlements: Grants entitlements to an existing flow.
operations.ListEntitlements: Displays a list of all entitlements that have been granted to this account. This request returns 20 results per page.
operations.ListFlows: Displays a list of flows that are associated with this account. This request returns a paginated result.
operations.ListOfferings: Displays a list of all offerings that are available to this account in the current AWS Region. If you have an active reservation (which means you've purchased an offering that has already started and hasn't expired yet), your account isn't eligible for other offerings.
operations.ListReservations: Displays a list of all reservations that have been purchased by this account in the current AWS Region. This list includes all reservations in all states (such as active and expired).
operations.ListTagsForResource: List all tags on an AWS Elemental MediaConnect resource
operations.PurchaseOffering: Submits a request to purchase an offering. If you already have an active reservation, you can't purchase another offering.
operations.RemoveFlowOutput: Removes an output from an existing flow. This request can be made only on an output that does not have an entitlement associated with it. If the output has an entitlement, you must revoke the entitlement instead. When an entitlement is revoked from a flow, the service automatically removes the associated output.
operations.RemoveFlowSource: Removes a source from an existing flow. This request can be made only if there is more than one source on the flow.
operations.RemoveFlowVpcInterface: Removes a VPC Interface from an existing flow. This request can be made only on a VPC interface that does not have a Source or Output associated with it. If the VPC interface is referenced by a Source or Output, you must first delete or update the Source or Output to no longer reference the VPC interface.
operations.RevokeFlowEntitlement: Revokes an entitlement from a flow. Once an entitlement is revoked, the content becomes unavailable to the subscriber and the associated output is removed.
operations.TagResource: Associates the specified tags to a resource with the specified resourceArn. If existing tags on a resource are not specified in the request parameters, they are not changed. When a resource is deleted, the tags associated with that resource are deleted as well.
operations.UntagResource: Deletes specified tags from a resource.
operations.UpdateFlowEntitlement: You can change an entitlement's description, subscribers, and encryption. If you change the subscribers, the service will remove the outputs that are are used by the subscribers that are removed.
operations.UpdateFlowSource: Updates the source of a flow.

AddFlowOutputs420Exception.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

AddFlowOutputsRequest.base: Adds outputs to an existing flow. You can create up to 50 outputs per flow.

AddFlowOutputsResponse.base: The result of a successful AddOutput request. The response includes the details of the newly added outputs.

AddFlowSourcesRequest.base: Adds sources to an existing flow.

AddFlowSourcesResponse.base: The result of a successful AddFlowSources request. The response includes the details of the newly added sources.

AddFlowVpcInterfacesRequest.base: Adds VPC interfaces to an existing flow.

AddFlowVpcInterfacesResponse.base: The result of a successful AddFlowVpcInterfaces request. The response includes the details of the newly added VPC interfaces.

AddOutputRequest.base: The output that you want to add to this flow.

refs.Encryption$Algorithm: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).
refs.UpdateEncryption$Algorithm: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

BadRequestException.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

CreateFlow420Exception.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

CreateFlowRequest.base: Creates a new flow. The request must include one source. The request optionally can include outputs (up to 50) and one entitlement.

CreateFlowResponse.base: The result of a successful CreateFlow request.

DeleteFlowResponse.base: The result of a successful DeleteFlow request.

DescribeFlowResponse.base: The result of a successful DescribeFlow request.

DescribeOfferingResponse.base: The result of a successful DescribeOffering request.

DescribeReservationResponse.base: The result of a successful DescribeReservation request.

refs.Offering$DurationUnits: The unit of measurement for the duration of the offering.
refs.Reservation$DurationUnits: The unit of measurement for the duration of the reservation. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

Encryption.base: Information about the encryption of the flow.

refs.AddOutputRequest$Encryption: The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
refs.Entitlement$Encryption: The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.
refs.GrantEntitlementRequest$Encryption: The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.
refs.Output$Encryption: The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
refs.SetSourceRequest$Decryption: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.
refs.Source$Decryption: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.

Entitlement.base: The settings for a flow entitlement.

refs.UpdateFlowEntitlementResponse$Entitlemen: The new configuration of the entitlement that you updated.

refs.Entitlement$EntitlementStatus: An indication of whether the entitlement is enabled.
refs.GrantEntitlementRequest$EntitlementStatu: An indication of whether the new entitlement should be enabled or disabled as soon as it is created. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect sets it to ENABLED.
refs.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest$Entitlement: An indication of whether you want to enable the entitlement to allow access, or disable it to stop streaming content to the subscriber’s flow temporarily. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect leaves the value unchanged.

Flow.base: The settings for a flow, including its source, outputs, and entitlements.

ForbiddenException.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

GrantEntitlementRequest.base: The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow.

GrantFlowEntitlements420Exception.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

GrantFlowEntitlementsRequest.base: Grants an entitlement on a flow.

GrantFlowEntitlementsResponse.base: The entitlements that were just granted.

InternalServerErrorException.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

refs.Encryption$KeyType: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
refs.UpdateEncryption$KeyType: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

ListEntitlementsResponse.base: The result of a successful ListEntitlements request. The response includes the ARN of each entitlement, the name of the associated flow, and the NextToken to use in a subsequent ListEntitlements request.

ListFlowsResponse.base: The result of a successful ListFlows request. The response includes flow summaries and the NextToken to use in a subsequent ListFlows request.

ListOfferingsResponse.base: The result of a successful ListOfferings request. The response includes the details of each offering that your account is eligible for. The response includes the following information for each offering: description, duration, outbound bandwidth, price, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), and the NextToken to use in a subsequent ListOfferings request.

ListReservationsResponse.base: The result of a successful ListReservations request. The response includes the details of each offering that your account is eligible for. The response includes the following information for each offering: description, duration, outbound bandwidth, price, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), and the NextToken to use in a subsequent ListOfferings request.

ListedEntitlement.base: An entitlement that has been granted to you from other AWS accounts.

ListedFlow.base: Provides a summary of a flow, including its ARN, Availability Zone, and source type.

Messages.base: Messages that provide the state of the flow.

NotFoundException.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

Offering.base: A savings plan that reserves a certain amount of outbound bandwidth usage at a discounted rate each month over a period of time.

refs.UpdateFlowOutputResponse$Output: The new settings of the output that you updated.

refs.Offering$PriceUnits: The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate.
refs.Reservation$PriceUnits: The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

refs.AddOutputRequest$Protocol: The protocol to use for the output.
refs.SetSourceRequest$Protocol: The protocol that is used by the source.
refs.Transport$Protocol: The protocol that is used by the source or output.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$Protocol: The protocol to use for the output.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$Protocol: The protocol that is used by the source.

PurchaseOfferingRequest.base: Submits a request to purchase an offering, which creates a reservation in your AWS account. If you already have an active reservation, you can't purchase another offering.

PurchaseOfferingResponse.base: The result of a successful PurchaseOffering request.

RemoveFlowOutputResponse.base: The result of a successful RemoveFlowOutput request including the flow ARN and the output ARN that was removed.

RemoveFlowSourceResponse.base: The result of a successful RemoveFlowSource request including the flow ARN and the source ARN that was removed.

RemoveFlowVpcInterfaceResponse.base: The result of a successful RemoveFlowVpcInterface request including the flow ARN and the VPC interface name that was removed.

Reservation.base: A pricing agreement for a discounted rate for a specific outbound bandwidth that your MediaConnect account will use each month over a specific time period. The discounted rate in the reservation applies to outbound bandwidth for all flows from your account until your account reaches the amount of bandwidth in your reservation. If you use more outbound bandwidth than the agreed upon amount in a single month, the overage is charged at the on-demand rate.

ResourceSpecification.base: A definition of what is being billed for, including the type and amount.

refs.Offering$ResourceSpecification: A definition of the amount of outbound bandwidth that you would be reserving if you purchase the offering.
refs.Reservation$ResourceSpecification: A definition of the amount of outbound bandwidth that you would be reserving if you purchase the offering. MediaConnect defines the values that make up the resourceSpecification in the offering.

refs.ResourceSpecification$ResourceType: The type of resource and the unit that is being billed for.

ResponseError.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

RevokeFlowEntitlementResponse.base: The result of a successful RevokeFlowEntitlement request. The response includes the ARN of the flow that was updated and the ARN of the entitlement that was revoked.

ServiceUnavailableException.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

SetSourceRequest.base: The settings for the source of the flow.

Source.base: The settings for the source of the flow.

refs.UpdateFlowSourceResponse$Source: The settings for the source of the flow.

refs.ListedFlow$SourceType: The type of source. This value is either owned (originated somewhere other than an AWS Elemental MediaConnect flow owned by another AWS account) or entitled (originated at an AWS Elemental MediaConnect flow owned by another AWS account).

StartFlowResponse.base: The result of a successful StartFlow request.

refs.DeleteFlowResponse$Status: The status of the flow when the DeleteFlow process begins.
refs.Flow$Status: The current status of the flow.
refs.ListedFlow$Status: The current status of the flow.
refs.StartFlowResponse$Status: The status of the flow when the StartFlow process begins.
refs.StopFlowResponse$Status: The status of the flow when the StopFlow process begins.

StopFlowResponse.base: The result of a successful StopFlow request.

TagResourceRequest.base: The tags to add to the resource. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

TooManyRequestsException.base: Exception raised by AWS Elemental MediaConnect. See the error message and documentation for the operation for more information on the cause of this exception.

Transport.base: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in a source or output.

refs.Output$Transport: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the output.
refs.Source$Transport: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the source.

UpdateEncryption.base: Information about the encryption of the flow.

refs.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest$Encryption: The type of encryption that will be used on the output associated with this entitlement.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$Encryption: The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$Decryption: The type of encryption used on the content ingested from this source.

UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.base: The updates that you want to make to a specific entitlement.

UpdateFlowEntitlementResponse.base: The result of a successful UpdateFlowEntitlement request. The response includes the ARN of the flow that was updated and the updated entitlement configuration.

UpdateFlowOutputRequest.base: The updates that you want to make to an existing output of an existing flow.

UpdateFlowOutputResponse.base: The result of a successful UpdateFlowOutput request including the flow ARN and the updated output.

UpdateFlowSourceRequest.base: The settings for the updated source of the flow.

UpdateFlowSourceResponse.base: The result of a successful UpdateFlowSource request. The response includes the ARN of the flow that was updated and the updated source configuration.

VpcInterface.base: The settings for a VPC Source.

VpcInterfaceAttachment.base: The settings for attaching a VPC interface to an output.

refs.AddOutputRequest$VpcInterfaceAttachment: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.
refs.Output$VpcInterfaceAttachment: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$VpcInterfaceAtta: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

VpcInterfaceRequest.base: Desired VPC Interface for a Flow

refs.AddOutputRequest$Port: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.
refs.Entitlement$DataTransferSubscriberFeePer: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
refs.FailoverConfig$RecoveryWindow: Search window time to look for dash-7 packets
refs.GrantEntitlementRequest$DataTransferSubs: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
refs.ListedEntitlement$DataTransferSubscriber: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
refs.Offering$Duration: The length of time that your reservation would be active.
refs.Output$DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
refs.Output$Port: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.
refs.Reservation$Duration: The length of time that this reservation is active. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
refs.ResourceSpecification$ReservedBitrate: The amount of outbound bandwidth that is discounted in the offering.
refs.SetSourceRequest$IngestPort: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
refs.Source$DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
refs.Source$IngestPort: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
refs.UpdateFailoverConfig$RecoveryWindow: Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$Port: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$IngestPort: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
refs.AddOutputRequest$MaxLatency: The maximum latency in milliseconds for Zixi-based streams.
refs.AddOutputRequest$SmoothingLatency: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
refs.SetSourceRequest$MaxBitrate: The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
refs.SetSourceRequest$MaxLatency: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.
refs.Transport$MaxBitrate: The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
refs.Transport$MaxLatency: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.
refs.Transport$SmoothingLatency: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$MaxLatency: The maximum latency in milliseconds for Zixi-based streams.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$SmoothingLatency: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$MaxBitrate: The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$MaxLatency: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

refs.AddFlowOutputsRequest$Outputs: A list of outputs that you want to add.
refs.CreateFlowRequest$Outputs: The outputs that you want to add to this flow.

refs.GrantFlowEntitlementsResponse$Entitlemen: The entitlements that were just granted.

refs.CreateFlowRequest$Entitlements: The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow.
refs.GrantFlowEntitlementsRequest$Entitlement: The list of entitlements that you want to grant.

refs.ListEntitlementsResponse$Entitlements: A list of entitlements that have been granted to you from other AWS accounts.

refs.ListOfferingsResponse$Offerings: A list of offerings that are available to this account in the current AWS Region.

refs.AddFlowOutputsResponse$Outputs: The details of the newly added outputs.

refs.ListReservationsResponse$Reservations: A list of all reservations that have been purchased by this account in the current AWS Region.

refs.AddFlowSourcesRequest$Sources: A list of sources that you want to add.

refs.AddFlowSourcesResponse$Sources: The details of the newly added sources.

refs.AddFlowVpcInterfacesResponse$VpcInterfac: The details of the newly added VPC interfaces.
refs.Flow$VpcInterfaces: The VPC Interfaces for this flow.

refs.AddFlowVpcInterfacesRequest$VpcInterface: A list of VPC interfaces that you want to add.
refs.CreateFlowRequest$VpcInterfaces: The VPC interfaces you want on the flow.

refs.AddOutputRequest$CidrAllowList: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
refs.Entitlement$Subscribers: The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.
refs.GrantEntitlementRequest$Subscribers: The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flows using your content as the source.
refs.Messages$Errors: A list of errors that might have been generated from processes on this flow.
refs.RemoveFlowVpcInterfaceResponse$NonDelete: IDs of network interfaces associated with the removed VPC interface that Media Connect was unable to remove.
refs.Transport$CidrAllowList: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
refs.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest$Subscribers: The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$CidrAllowList: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
refs.VpcInterface$NetworkInterfaceIds: IDs of the network interfaces created in customer's account by MediaConnect.
refs.VpcInterface$SecurityGroupIds: Security Group IDs to be used on ENI.
refs.VpcInterfaceRequest$SecurityGroupIds: Security Group IDs to be used on ENI.

refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$Tags: A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

refs.AddFlowOutputsResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that these outputs were added to.
refs.AddFlowSourcesResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that these sources were added to.
refs.AddFlowVpcInterfacesResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that these VPC interfaces were added to.
refs.AddOutputRequest$Description: A description of the output. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the end user.
refs.AddOutputRequest$Destination: The IP address from which video will be sent to output destinations.
refs.AddOutputRequest$Name: The name of the output. This value must be unique within the current flow.
refs.AddOutputRequest$RemoteId: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull output stream.
refs.AddOutputRequest$StreamId: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
refs.CreateFlowRequest$AvailabilityZone: The Availability Zone that you want to create the flow in. These options are limited to the Availability Zones within the current AWS Region.
refs.DeleteFlowResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that was deleted.
refs.Encryption$ConstantInitializationVector: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.Encryption$DeviceId: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.Encryption$Region: The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.Encryption$ResourceId: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.Encryption$RoleArn: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).
refs.Encryption$SecretArn: The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.
refs.Encryption$Url: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.Flow$AvailabilityZone: The Availability Zone that you want to create the flow in. These options are limited to the Availability Zones within the current AWS.
refs.Flow$Description: A description of the flow. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
refs.Flow$EgressIp: The IP address from which video will be sent to output destinations.
refs.Flow$FlowArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier for any AWS resource, of the flow.
refs.GrantEntitlementRequest$Description: A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.
refs.GrantEntitlementRequest$Name: The name of the entitlement. This value must be unique within the current flow.
refs.GrantFlowEntitlementsResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that these entitlements were granted to.
refs.ListEntitlementsResponse$NextToken: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListEntitlements request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListEntitlements request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
refs.ListFlowsResponse$NextToken: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListFlows request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListFlows request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
refs.ListOfferingsResponse$NextToken: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListOfferings request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListOfferings request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
refs.ListReservationsResponse$NextToken: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListReservations request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListReservations request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
refs.ListedFlow$AvailabilityZone: The Availability Zone that the flow was created in.
refs.Offering$CurrencyCode: The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for all reservations is US dollars.
refs.Offering$OfferingArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.
refs.Offering$PricePerUnit: The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate.
refs.Output$Destination: The address where you want to send the output.
refs.Output$EntitlementArn: The ARN of the entitlement on the originator''s flow. This value is relevant only on entitled flows.
refs.Output$MediaLiveInputArn: The input ARN of the AWS Elemental MediaLive channel. This parameter is relevant only for outputs that were added by creating a MediaLive input.
refs.Output$Name: The name of the output. This value must be unique within the current flow.
refs.PurchaseOfferingRequest$ReservationName: The name that you want to use for the reservation.
refs.PurchaseOfferingRequest$Start: The date and time that you want the reservation to begin, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). You can specify any date and time between 12:00am on the first day of the current month to the current time on today's date, inclusive. Specify the start in a 24-hour notation. Use the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ, where T and Z are literal characters. For example, to specify 11:30pm on March 5, 2020, enter 2020-03-05T23:30:00Z.
refs.RemoveFlowOutputResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the output you removed.
refs.RemoveFlowOutputResponse$OutputArn: The ARN of the output that was removed.
refs.RemoveFlowSourceResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the source you removed.
refs.RemoveFlowSourceResponse$SourceArn: The ARN of the source that was removed.
refs.RemoveFlowVpcInterfaceResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the VPC interface you removed.
refs.RemoveFlowVpcInterfaceResponse$VpcInterf: The name of the VPC interface that was removed.
refs.Reservation$CurrencyCode: The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for your reservation is US dollars.
refs.Reservation$End: The day and time that this reservation expires. This value is calculated based on the start date and time that you set and the offering's duration.
refs.Reservation$OfferingArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.
refs.Reservation$OfferingDescription: A description of the offering. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
refs.Reservation$PricePerUnit: The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
refs.Reservation$ReservationArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the reservation when you purchase an offering.
refs.Reservation$ReservationName: The name that you assigned to the reservation when you purchased the offering.
refs.Reservation$Start: The day and time that the reservation becomes active. You set this value when you purchase the offering.
refs.ResponseError$Message: The error message returned by AWS Elemental MediaConnect.
refs.RevokeFlowEntitlementResponse$Entitlemen: The ARN of the entitlement that was revoked.
refs.RevokeFlowEntitlementResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that the entitlement was revoked from.
refs.SetSourceRequest$Description: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
refs.SetSourceRequest$EntitlementArn: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
refs.SetSourceRequest$StreamId: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
refs.SetSourceRequest$VpcInterfaceName: The name of the VPC interface to use for this source.
refs.SetSourceRequest$WhitelistCidr: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
refs.Source$Description: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
refs.Source$EntitlementArn: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to content that comes from another AWS account. The entitlement is set by the content originator and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
refs.Source$IngestIp: The IP address that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
refs.Source$VpcInterfaceName: The name of the VPC Interface this Source is configured with.
refs.Source$WhitelistCidr: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
refs.StartFlowResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that you started.
refs.StopFlowResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that you stopped.
refs.Transport$RemoteId: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.
refs.Transport$StreamId: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
refs.UpdateEncryption$ConstantInitializationV: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.UpdateEncryption$DeviceId: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.UpdateEncryption$Region: The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.UpdateEncryption$ResourceId: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.UpdateEncryption$RoleArn: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).
refs.UpdateEncryption$SecretArn: The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.
refs.UpdateEncryption$Url: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
refs.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest$Description: A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.
refs.UpdateFlowEntitlementResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that this entitlement was granted on.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$Description: A description of the output. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the end user.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$Destination: The IP address where you want to send the output.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$RemoteId: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputRequest$StreamId: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
refs.UpdateFlowOutputResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the updated output.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$Description: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$EntitlementArn: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$StreamId: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$VpcInterfaceName: The name of the VPC Interface to configure this Source with.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceRequest$WhitelistCidr: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
refs.UpdateFlowSourceResponse$FlowArn: The ARN of the flow that you want to update.
refs.VpcInterface$Name: Immutable and has to be a unique against other VpcInterfaces in this Flow
refs.VpcInterface$RoleArn: Role Arn MediaConnect can assumes to create ENIs in customer's account
refs.VpcInterface$SubnetId: Subnet must be in the AZ of the Flow
refs.VpcInterfaceAttachment$VpcInterfaceName: The name of the VPC interface to use for this output.
refs.VpcInterfaceRequest$Name: The name of the VPC Interface. This value must be unique within the current flow.
refs.VpcInterfaceRequest$RoleArn: Role Arn MediaConnect can assumes to create ENIs in customer's account
refs.VpcInterfaceRequest$SubnetId: Subnet must be in the AZ of the Flow
